messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: INCIDENT REPORT: AK-3456-LM DATE: 10/10/23  Vandalism at the City Mural Park. Approx. 10:05 AM, Patrolman R. S. T. White reported defacement of three murals. People involved: Artist Ms. Nina Rodriguez and City Councilman Mr. Paul Desmond. ATTENTION - NECESSARY PROBE BY: URBAN PATROL DIVISION - MEDIA COVERAGE EXPECTED.  Lieut. U. V. W. Martinez was on duty, seconded by Forensic Expert Adrian. LOCATION: 67 City Mural Park Lane. 11:00 Paint cans found. Local business owners Mr. Greg Summers and Mrs. Danielle Frost noticed two teenagers fleeing. Digital Analyst Claire initiated a scan of nearby CCTV footage.  FORWARD TO: URBAN PATROL DIVISION 9 - QUICK BRIEF [HIGHLIGHT] Forensic Expert Adrian, Lieut. Martinez. PRESENT: Patrolman White. DOCUMENTS LINKED: Frost, Danielle 12 Park Side St, Urbanville, Washington 990-123. 67890. CITY MURAL 11:30 Art Damage.  By noon, Lieut. Martinez, in conjunction with Captain X. Y. Z. Green, rounded up potential witnesses. Detective A. B. C. Turner and Patrolman D. E. F. Lee gathered statements. Around 12:30 PM, a nearby shop's camera captured images of the suspects.  RELAY TO: URBAN PATROL DIVISION 9 - KEY POINTS [MARK] Digital Analyst Claire, Detective Turner. LEAD: Lieut. Martinez. CLUES COLLECTED: (1) Defaced Murals (2) Discarded Paint Cans (3) Eye-witness Reports (4) Digital Footage (5) Handwritten Notes by Vandals (6) Shoe Impressions LEAD INVESTIGATOR L. M. N. Parker U.P.D. 90.567 R18 1234 Rodriguez, NINA. FILE: LOCATION: CONTACT: 789-0123 OFFICER: R. White ID: VK-7890- 333 VANDALISM TIME: 10:05 CODE 12345 - REGISTERED Peter Thompson DATE 10/11/23 DISPATCH TO: URBAN PATROL DIVISION.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Patrolman R. S. T. White  
Officer Context: Approx. 10:05 AM, Patrolman R. S. T. White reported defacement of three murals.  
Officer Role: Patrolman 

Officer Name: Lieut. U. V. W. Martinez  
Officer Context: Lieut. U. V. W. Martinez was on duty.  
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Forensic Expert Adrian  
Officer Context: Lieut. U. V. W. Martinez was on duty, seconded by Forensic Expert Adrian.  
Officer Role: Forensic Expert 

Officer Name: Digital Analyst Claire  
Officer Context: Digital Analyst Claire initiated a scan of nearby CCTV footage.  
Officer Role: Digital Analyst 

Officer Name: Captain X. Y. Z. Green  
Officer Context: Lieut. Martinez, in conjunction with Captain X. Y. Z. Green.  
Officer Role: Captain 

Officer Name: Detective A. B. C. Turner  
Officer Context: Detective A. B. C. Turner and Patrolman D. E. F. Lee gathered statements.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Patrolman D. E. F. Lee  
Officer Context: Detective A. B. C. Turner and Patrolman D. E. F. Lee gathered statements.  
Officer Role: Patrolman
